column1: One of the best game music soundtracks - for a game I didn't really play: Despite the fact that I have only played a small portion of the game
column2: the music I heard (plus the connection to Chrono Trigger which was great as well) led me to purchase the soundtrack
column3: and it remains one of my favorite albums. There is an incredible mix of fun
column5: and emotional songs. Those sad and beautiful tracks I especially like
column6: as there's not too many of those kinds of songs in my other video game soundtracks. I must admit that one of the songs (Life-A Distant Promise) has brought tears to my eyes on many occasions.My one complaint about this soundtrack is that they use guitar fretting effects in many of the songs
column7: which I find distracting. But even if those weren't included I would still consider the collection worth it.

column1: Batteries died within a year ...: I bought this charger in Jul 2003 and it worked OK for a while. The design is nice and convenient. However
column3: the batteries would not hold a charge. Might as well just get alkaline disposables
column4: or look elsewhere for a charger that comes with batteries that have better staying power.

column2: but Maha Energy is better: Check out Maha Energy's website. Their Powerex MH-C204F charger works in 100 minutes for rapid charge
column3: with option for slower charge (better for batteries). And they have 2200 mAh batteries.
